title: Soaring rental market - what it means
summary: The Malaysian rental market saw significant growth in the second quarter of 2024 (2Q24), with rents rising faster than anticipated, a trend that could have important implications for the property industry.
content:
The Malaysian rental market saw significant growth in the second quarter of 2024 (2Q24), with rents rising faster than anticipated, a trend that could have important implications for the property industry.

According to the recently released 2Q24 IQI Malaysia Home Rental Index, the average rent reached RM1,995, a 3.9% increase from the previous quarter and 2.9% higher than the same period last year.

title: From home to famous film set
summary: Malaysia’s film industry has experienced a remarkable surge in recent years. Fuelled by government initiatives, international collaborations and the country’s stunning landscapes, the demand for unique and visually appealing filming locations has skyrocketed.
content:
Malaysia’s film industry has experienced a remarkable surge in recent years. Fuelled by government initiatives, international collaborations and the country’s stunning landscapes, the demand for unique and visually appealing filming locations has skyrocketed.

This presents a previously untapped opportunity for property owners facing vacancies. Transforming their spaces into lucrative film sets.

title: Hajiji: Over 7,000 jobs created for Sabah residents
summary: A total of 7,448 job placements for Sabah residents have been successfully implemented as of Sept 27, thanks to various efforts by the government through the Social Security Organisation (Perkeso) and other involved agencies.
content:
KOTA KINABALU (Oct 12): A total of 7,448 job placements for Sabah residents have been successfully implemented as of Sept 27, thanks to various efforts by the government through the Social Security Organisation (Perkeso) and other involved agencies.

Chief Minister Datuk Seri Hajiji Noor said these initiatives were crucial in improving the employability of Sabahans, and he urged all parties, including government and private sector agencies, to work together to reduce unemployment in the state.

title: Agriculture Ministry assures country's rice supply is sufficient
summary: The Agriculture and Food Security Ministry (KPKM) guarantees that the rice supply in local markets will not be affected despite the flood situation in Kedah and Perlis, impacting approximately 6,000 hectares of the country's paddy production areas.
content:
PONTIAN (Oct 12): The Agriculture and Food Security Ministry (KPKM) guarantees that the rice supply in local markets will not be affected despite the flood situation in Kedah and Perlis, impacting approximately 6,000 hectares of the country's paddy production areas.

Its minister, Datuk Seri Mohamad Sabu, said as a measure to ensure food security, the country has signed agreements with several rice-producing countries, including India and Pakistan, for import purposes to ensure a sufficient rice supply in the c

title: Motac launches investigation to identify agents spreading wrong info about MM2H programme
summary: The Tourism, Arts and Culture Ministry (Motac) has launched an investigation to identify Malaysia My Second Home (MM2H) agents responsible for spreading misinformation regarding the programme.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 12): The Tourism, Arts and Culture Ministry (Motac) has launched an investigation to identify Malaysia My Second Home (MM2H) agents responsible for spreading misinformation regarding the programme.

Its minister, Datuk Seri Tiong King Sing, stated that this action followed complaints from applicants, including claims that the programme is not yet operational and that applications cannot be accepted.

“I want to remind some agents to cease circula

title: Fahmi: TikTok's operations in Malaysia not affected by staff lay-offs, cooperating with authorities
summary: TikTok's move to reduce its employees will not affect its operations and the company is cooperating with the authorities in this country, especially in the aspects of research and screening of content and live sessions.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 12): TikTok's move to reduce its employees will not affect its operations and the company is cooperating with the authorities in this country, especially in the aspects of research and screening of content and live sessions.

Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said that based on his meeting with TikTok Malaysia on Friday, the company informed that the number of workers in the country is still high, at around 3,700 people, with lay-offs involving 481 workers.

title: Kenanga IB expects govt to raise development expenditure in Budget 2025
summary: The government is expected to allocate a higher development expenditure (DE) of RM94.5 billion in Budget 2025, from RM88.5 billion in 2024’s forecast, to boost infrastructure play, said Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd (Kenanga IB).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 12): The government is expected to allocate a higher development expenditure (DE) of RM94.5 billion in Budget 2025, from RM88.5 billion in 2024’s forecast, to boost infrastructure play, said Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd (Kenanga IB).

In a note on Saturday, Kenanga IB said transport is expected to continue holding the largest share of DE, primarily driven by the anticipated revival of the Mass Rapid Transit 3 (MRT3) project and the Kuala Lumpur-Singapore high-speed rail (KL-SG HSR).

title: King, Queen of Malaysia to undertake state visit to Brunei on Sunday
summary: The King and Queen of Malaysia, Sultan Ibrahim Sultan Iskandar and Raja Zarith Sofiah, will undertake a state visit to Brunei on Sunday until Oct 15, marking the Agong’s inaugural state visit to the sultanate since ascending the throne on Jan 31 this year.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 12): The King and Queen of Malaysia, Sultan Ibrahim Sultan Iskandar and Raja Zarith Sofiah, will undertake a state visit to Brunei on Sunday until Oct 15, marking the Agong’s inaugural state visit to the sultanate since ascending the throne on Jan 31 this year.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs in a statement on Saturday said the state visit will further strengthen the close and special relationship between Malaysia and Brunei Darussalam, underpinned by the Malay sultanate institution, religion

title: Avaland opens Avenue25 sales gallery in Subang Jaya, previews Alora Residences Tower B
summary: Avaland Bhd (KL:AVALAND) officially opened the sales gallery of Avenue25 and previewed Tower B of Alora Residences serviced apartments in Subang Jaya, Selangor, on Saturday.
content:
SUBANG JAYA (Oct 12): Avaland Bhd (KL:AVALAND) officially opened the sales gallery of Avenue25 and previewed Tower B of Alora Residences serviced apartments in Subang Jaya, Selangor, on Saturday.

Avenue25 is a 13.4-acre freehold mixed-development with an estimated gross development value (GDV) of RM3 billion located at USJ25 in Subang Jaya.

title: MDEC eyes RM300 mil in export opportunities at GITEX Global tech event in Dubai
summary: The Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC) said it expects to attract export opportunities worth RM300 million from its participation at this year's Gulf Information Technology Exhibition (GITEX) Global and Expand North Star (ENS) in Dubai.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 12): The Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC) said it expects to attract export opportunities worth RM300 million from its participation at this year's Gulf Information Technology Exhibition (GITEX) Global and Expand North Star (ENS) in Dubai.

GITEX Global, the largest technology event in the world, will be held from Oct 14 to 18, while ENS, a gathering for start-ups and investors, will take place from Oct 13 to 16.

title: Kerjaya Prospek files lawsuit to claim guarantees by Yong Tai, CEO
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Kerjaya Prospek Group Bhd has initiated legal action against Yong Tai Bhd and its CEO to claim guarantees provided by the company and the CEO, for the outstanding sum of RM105.14 million it is demanding in connection with a construction project in Melaka.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Kerjaya Prospek Group Bhd has initiated legal action against Yong Tai Bhd and its CEO to claim guarantees provided by the company and the CEO, for the outstanding sum of RM105.14 million it is demanding in connection with a construction project in Melaka.

According to a Bursa Malaysia Securities filing, its subsidiary, Kerjaya Prospek (M) Sdn Bhd, served a writ of summons and statement of claim against Yong Tai and its chief executive, Datuk Boo Kuang Loon, to claim the corporate and personal guarantees provided f

title: Kerjaya Prospek files new lawsuit against Yong Tai, CEO
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Kerjaya Prospek Group Bhd has initiated legal action against Yong Tai Bhd and its CEO over an alleged unpaid contract sum of RM105.14 million in connection with a construction project in Melaka.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Kerjaya Prospek Group Bhd has initiated legal action against Yong Tai Bhd and its CEO over an alleged unpaid contract sum of RM105.14 million in connection with a construction project in Melaka.

According to The Edge, Kerjaya Prospek, in a Bursa Malaysia filing, said its subsidiary, Kerjaya Prospek (M) Sdn Bhd, served a writ of summons and statement of claim to Yong Tai and its chief executive, Datuk Boo Kuang Loon.

title: Education leaders urged to embrace AI in preparing future generations
summary: Educational leaders and administrators are urged to harness the latest technological advancements, particularly artificial intelligence (AI), to avoid falling behind and to equip students for success in a rapidly evolving global landscape.
content:
JITRA (Oct 12): Educational leaders and administrators are urged to harness the latest technological advancements, particularly artificial intelligence (AI), to avoid falling behind and to equip students for success in a rapidly evolving global landscape.

Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail emphasised the crucial role of principals, headmasters and teachers in ensuring their students are at least acquainted with the concept of AI.

“If we do not ad

title: Abang Johari: Acquisition of MASwings to be finalised soon
summary: The acquisition of MASwings Sdn Bhd by the Sarawak government is expected to be finalised soon, said Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg.
content:
KUCHING (Oct 12): The acquisition of MASwings Sdn Bhd by the Sarawak government is expected to be finalised soon, said Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg.

He said that the acquisition is currently in the advanced negotiation stage.

"Sarawak needs control over its own air services, not only to facilitate passenger transportation but more importantly, as an investment for economic growth," he said in his speech during the Grand Parade in conjunction wi

title: Ringgit seen trading cautiously vs US dollar next week ahead of Budget 2025
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is projected to trade sideways against the US dollar next week amid worries over China’s economy and rising geopolitical risks, ahead of Malaysia’s Budget 2025.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is projected to trade sideways against the US dollar next week amid worries over China’s economy and rising geopolitical risks, ahead of Malaysia’s Budget 2025.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said all eyes will be on the Budget 2025 presentation by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim, scheduled for next Friday.

"Budget 2025 should provide some clear direction as the government is likely to remain

title: Federal Territories to explore smart collaboration with Huawei, BYD, says Zaliha
summary: Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Federal Territories) Dr Zaliha Mustafa held discussions with two prominent global companies, Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and BYD, to explore smart collaboration aimed at fostering sustainable development within the Federal Territories.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 12): Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Federal Territories) Dr Zaliha Mustafa held discussions with two prominent global companies, Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and BYD, to explore smart collaboration aimed at fostering sustainable development within the Federal Territories.

Both companies not only lead in technological advancements in China but have also broadened their reach globally, including in Malaysia.

title: The Week Ahead: Attention on Budget 2025, China data and major economies’ monetary policies
summary: The main focus in Malaysia this week will be on Budget 2025, which is scheduled to be tabled by the prime minister on Friday. Many economists expect the overall budget to remain expansionary, with supportive measures to address the elevated cost of living, improve the people’s quality of life, enhance rural development and transform the economy at a sustainable pace.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on October 14, 2024 - October 20, 2024

summary: The appointment of Datuk Mohd Izani Ghani as the new managing director of Malaysia Airports Holdings Berhad (MAHB) signals a new era of transformation.
content:

title: Transforming QSR Brands to drive value
summary: Malaysians have a huge appetite for chicken, leading the region in terms of per capita consumption.
content:
MALAYSIANS have a huge appetite for chicken, leading the region in terms of per capita consumption.

According to data compiled by the United Nations’ Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) in 2020, Malaysians consume approximately 50.5 kg of chicken per person each year, ahead of Singaporeans, who have a per capita consumption rate of 36 kg, and Myanmar at 29.9 kg, both ranked second and third in Asean.

This escalating demand for chicken has spurred the growth of the

title: Picking up the pieces from MBI’s collapse
summary:
The acronym MBI if spelt backwards is IBM, the US-based computer main frame technology company with a global reach.

Tedy Teow Wooi Huat, the prime figure behind the disgraced MBI, wanted a global reach similar to IBM.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 12): The acronym MBI if spelt backwards is IBM, the US-based computer main frame technology company with a global reach.

Tedy Teow Wooi Huat, the prime figure behind the disgraced MBI, wanted a global reach similar to IBM.  

In his talks to members, he would always drive home the point why the acronym MBI was chosen, which was to expand its reach beyond Malaysia.

title: ByteDance to cut hundreds of jobs
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: ByteDance Ltd, the parent company of TikTok, has announced potential layoffs affecting several hundred employees worldwide including Malaysia.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: ByteDance Ltd, the parent company of TikTok, has announced potential layoffs affecting several hundred employees worldwide including Malaysia.

A TikTok spokesperson revealed the company plans to invest US$2 billion globally in trust and safety initiatives throughout 2024, focusing on improving the efficiency and impact of its content moderation efforts.

"We are making these changes as part of our ongoing efforts to further strengthen our global operating model for content moderation," the spokesperson told B

title: Move to merge agencies will provide clarity, save costs - Economists
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Agriculture and Food Security Ministry’s (KPKM) decision to merge seven enforcement agencies will both provide clarity and save costs for players, benefitting the agriculture sector.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Agriculture and Food Security Ministry's (KPKM) decision to merge seven enforcement agencies will both provide clarity and save costs for players, benefitting the agriculture sector.

Economist Dr Geoffrey Williams said the merger will streamline regulations, reducing redundancy, contradictions, and replication. 

He added that this clarity will help agro-industry players understand the regulatory landscape better and save costs through a centralised administrative system.

title: Robust financial health pertinent for sustainable power supply
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The role played by national power utility companies is more critical than ever in an era where energy demands continue to rise and the push for sustainable practices grows stronger.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The role played by national power utility companies is more critical than ever in an era where energy demands continue to rise and the push for sustainable practices grows stronger.

Hence, the financial health of these firms including Tenaga Nasional Bhd (TNB), is pertinent to ensure that electricity continues to be generated, distributed and maintained efficiently.

content:

summary: Oil prices settled lower on Friday but rose for the second straight week as investors weighed factors such as possible supply disruptions in the Middle East and Hurricane Milton's impact on fuel demand in Florida.
content:

title: S&P 500, Dow hit records on bank earnings
summary: The S&P 500 and the Dow scored record closing highs on Friday, with the big boosts from financial stocks after banks reported strong quarterly results while the latest inflation data fueled expectations for a US Federal Reserve rate cut in November.
content:
The Dow rose 409.74 points, or 0.97%, to 42,863.86, the S&P 500 gained 34.98 points, or 0.61%, to 5,815.03 and the Nasdaq gained 60.89 points, or 0.33%, to 18,342.94.

summary: Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcement that made the headlines on Friday.

title: Crafting a unique scent
summary: Something is in the air in the fragrance industry. An arena once dominated by the likes of iconic designer classics such as Chanel No 5 and Dior J’adore has, in recent years, seen niche luxury brands such as Diptyque, Creed and Maison Francis Kurkdjian come to the fore.
content:
Niche retailers like Escentials have grown significantly across South-East Asia in recent years. — Luxasia

title: Keeping faith in Malaysia
summary: While foreign shareholding in Bursa Malaysia stocks has recovered from recent lows, there is still plenty of room for foreign buyers to add on to their positions, if they adopt an “overweight” position on Malaysian equities, and for the longer term.
content:
WHILE foreign shareholding in Bursa Malaysia stocks has recovered from recent lows, there is still plenty of room for foreign buyers to add on to their positions, if they adopt an “overweight” position on Malaysian equities, and for the longer term.

The climb towards a higher foreign shareholding, however, is likely to be gradual, with some volatility in between, market observers generally agree.

title: Iskandar Puteri keeps thriving
summary: CIMB Securities Research recently visited two major developments in Iskandar Puteri, Johor: the 2,000-acre integrated township, Sunway City Iskandar Puteri (SCIP) by Sunway Bhd – the largest in the area – and Puteri Harbour, a prime waterfront development by UEM Sunrise Bhd (UEM Sunrise), which also has an international ferry terminal.

content:

FROM a home kitchen to a multi-million-ringgit business with over 15 cafes and restaurants across the country, Gula Cakery’s journey can certainly be described as one of sweet success.

title: What lies ahead
summary: AS we are in the final stretch of 2024, how will the market perform in the fourth quarter (4Q24)?
content:
AS we are in the final stretch of 2024, how will the market perform in the fourth quarter (4Q24)?

title: High income, with high quality of life
summary: Malaysia's Vision 2020 was an ambitious plan which wanted the country to not only achieve high income status but also developed high income status by the year 2020.
content:
MALAYSIA’S Vision 2020 was an ambitious plan which wanted the country to not only achieve high income status but also developed high income status by the year 2020.

There is a difference between the two objectives – one is to attain a certain level of income based on US dollars, and the second is to see Malaysia evolve progressively in many aspects of life.

title: ZUS Coffee funding deal brews interest
summary: ZUS Coffee’s latest funding deal piques interest on a few levels.
content:
ZUS Coffee’s latest funding deal piques interest on a few levels.

For one, it cements the point that coffee chain valuations have reached super-sized valuations.

title: Lessons of reform from Black Monday
summary: On Oct 19, 1987, following three days of decline in the New York stock market, the Hong Kong market dropped 10.5% after a rise of 89% in the earlier 12 months.
content:
ON Oct 19, 1987, following three days of decline in the New York stock market, the Hong Kong market dropped 10.5% after a rise of 89% in the earlier 12 months.

It was Black Monday, when the New York stock market plunged, triggering a severe worldwide stock crash.

title: Tough lessons from Turkiye
summary: The Turkyish economy, which is among the world’s top 20 with a US$1.1 trillion gross domestic product, is one of the most affected by the Covid-19 pandemic. While inflation was high, the government used an unorthodox method to keep local interest rates at a relatively low level in order to contain inflation rates.
content:
THE Turkyish economy, which is among the world’s top 20 with a US$1.1 trillion gross domestic product, is one of the most affected by the Covid-19 pandemic. While inflation was high, the government used an unorthodox method to keep local interest rates at a relatively low level in order to contain inflation rates.

The pandemic and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine caused inflation to soar worldwide. While almost every central bank

title: Navigating a bull market as a retail investor
summary: I was at an event recently and a young remisier spoke to me about the market. Considering the stock market has done very well this year, I assumed she was having a wonderful year too.
content:
woman's hand giving a bitcoin coin to another woman

I WAS at an event recently and a young remisier spoke to me about the market. Considering the stock market has done very well this year, I assumed she was having a wonderful year too.

To my surprise, she mentioned it has been a downtrodden year for her, as many of her clients (mostly retail investors) were cashing out of stocks rather than reinvesting or

title: Building endurance for the economic race
summary: Last Sunday, I completed my first half marathon since 2020. I was happy to maintain a solid pace to complete the 21.1-km run with a few good friends.
content:
LAST Sunday, I completed my first half marathon since 2020. I was happy to maintain a solid pace to complete the 21.1-km run with a few good friends.

Improving Malaysia’s economic outlook is much like a marathon, not a sprint. While we have been racing ahead, we must not lose our momentum.

title: Takaful Malaysia eyes RM10mil in premiums for Kaotim Car and Kaotim Motor
summary: Kaotim, the online platform operated by Syarikat Takaful Malaysia Keluarga Bhd, has introduced two new products – Kaotim Car and Kaotim Motor – aiming to achieve a collection target of RM10mil in car and motorcycle premiums this year.
content:
All settled: Takaful Malaysia Am’s Mohamed Sabri and Takaful Malaysia’s Nor Azman at the launch of Kaotim Car and Kaotim Motor in Penang. These new offerings are part of Takaful Malaysia’s efforts to expand its digital insurance and takaful services.
